Laboratory:
Laboratory for Neural Circuits and Behavior, RIKEN Brain Science Institute
(Laboratory Head: Andrea Benucci)

Research field:
Our lab studies the neural basis of visual perception in mice trained to perform behavioral tasks. Using a combination of computational and experimental approaches (electrophysiology, fluorescence imaging, and optogenetics), we aim to understand how activations of neuronal populations in the visual cortex give rise to a visual percept.

Job title:
Postdoctoral positions

[仕事内容(業務内容、担当科目等)]
Job description:
The project will focus on combining theoretical and experimental approaches to capture key computational aspects of cortical processing in large neuronal populations.

data.応募資格: We seek exceptional candidates with a strong computational background, especially in the field of large-scale neural network simulations. Candidates should have a Ph.D. in a relevant field (e.g., Computational Neuroscience, Computer Science, Math, Physics). Proficiency in programming (e.g., MATLAB, C++) is necessary. The ideal candidate will be interested in engaging in experimental work as well.
data.待遇: Salary and benefits:The employment contract is renewable on a yearly basis based on performance evaluation up to March 2018. Salary will be commensurate with qualifications and experience. Social insurance will be applied. Free, mandatory membership in the RIKEN Mutual Benefit Society (RIKEN Kyosaikai) will be provided. These and other provisions are in accordance with RIKEN regulations. RIKEN is promoting a Gender Equity Program by taking various measures to create a workplace where both men and women are able to give full rein to their talents and abilities.http://www.riken.go.jp/en/careers/working-at-riken/benefits/Postdocs are eligible for an exemption from repayment for category 1 scholarship loans provided by the Japan Student Services Organization before fiscal year 2003, and are eligible to apply for the MEXT Grants-in-Aid for Scientific Research (Kakenhi).
